meanings.definition: Decomposed leaves used as a soil conditioner.
meanings.sent1: The gardener spread leafmold over the flower beds to help the plants grow.
meanings.sent2: Using leafmold in gardening can improve the quality of the soil.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to play in the pile of leafmold instead of collecting nuts.
meanings.sent4: The forest floor was a soft carpet of leafmold, nature's own compost.
meanings.sent5: The earthy smell of leafmold reminded her of the changing seasons.

meanings.sent1: She likes to leafmold the garden to protect the soil from erosion.
meanings.sent2: In autumn, the ground becomes leafmolded with fallen leaves.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to leafmold the backyard as a surprise for their parents.
meanings.sent4: The wind would leafmold the paths with colorful leaves, creating a natural carpet.
meanings.sent5: He carefully leafmolds around delicate plants to shield them from harsh weather.

meanings.sent1: The compost bin was full of materials in various stages of leafmolding.
meanings.sent2: Learning about the leafmold process can help in sustainable gardening.
meanings.sent3: The leafmold production workshop was both educational and fun for the participants.
meanings.sent4: The factory specialized in the efficient production of leafmold for agricultural use.
meanings.sent5: Her enthusiasm for leafmold-making inspired others to start their own compost piles.
